title: Ant-Backed Payments Firm Kakaopay Jumps on Market Debut in Seoul
sub_head: Kakaopay had raised $1.3 billion from share sale
body:
South Koreaâ€™s technology industry continues to spawn big public companies, despite concerns that a government crackdown could hurt profits.
On Wednesday, mobile-payments specialist Kakaopay Corp. became the latest to join the stock market after a heavily oversubscribed $1.3 billion share sale. By the end of the trading session in Seoul, the stock had more than doubled from its initial public offering price, giving Kakaopay a valuation of more than $21 billion.
